review_title: Great job to practice customer service and art appreciation!
job_title: Museum Assistant in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Understanding of student schedules, engagement with the community, and peaceful work environment.
cons: Some positions like this one are only available to current students. Understandable, but still a bummer to leave a wonderful job open for the next student.

job_title: Manager of Media Relations in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Located in the foothills of Montecito just a few miles from the beach, Westmont is 110 acres of natural beauty. The Christian college staff are caring and supportive.
cons: It is expensive to live in Santa Barbara.

job_title: Assistant Director in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Health benefits, consistent paycheck, location and proximity to nature
cons: Narcissistic and dishonest leaders, terrible pay, poor career advancement options, unhappy alcoholic coworkers, discrimination culture, frequent screaming and backstabbing

job_title: Admissions Assistant in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: They work with students and their unique schedules and breaks. They have patience with the learning curve while still holding high performance expectations.
cons: Favoritism within team and unhappy management at times.

job_title: Sales Representative in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Great people, great job, great experience
cons: Not much to say here. It was great.

job_title: Secretary in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Awesome coworkers- I love the community.
cons: There aren't any- some people dont love a 9-5 job but it is a good one!

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Good work environment and nice staff

job_title: Student Worker in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Flexible, expectations clearly communicated, variety in work

job_title: Mailing Services Coordinator in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Great community; Everyone genuinely cares about each other

The people

job_title: Administration in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Beautiful campus, decent benefits, WeMo will match 7% to your 3% to your retirement, tuition exchange for you, spouse and kids, but no graduate programs.
cons: I'm usually the only minority in my office. My boss (a white WeMo alum) has said many times that her idea of diversity for our office is more men since there's only one in an office of 5. She also randomly told me that her husband (also a white WeMo alum) hates homosexuals. Never reported it since I felt her attitude is common an WeMo. There's definitely a glass ceiling for women, an even lower glass ceiling for women of color.

job_title: Administration in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Couldn't be happier in a workplace. Great leadership, sufficient compensation, and a super institutional mission. Oh, and such good-hearted, capable colleagues. It's unusual to work in a place with such clarity of mission—and that actively and genuinely seeks to live by it.
cons: I do wish we had more racial diversity. I understand that it's hard to enter a situation as a minority. But I believe we truly want to be a welcoming community that makes room for differences, and values them—and the people who embody the differences.

review_title: I mainly work with putting data into Salesforce, but I am adaptive and have also helped with mail merch.
job_title: Data Entry Clerk in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: I am able to work while also being a student and athlete at Westmont. Along with that, I am able to work as much as my schedule will allow during the week, which usually ends up to be 7 hours a week. I am very detail-oriented and enjoy data Entry.
cons: There are not any cons that I can think of. I’ve worked on many different projects throughout  the year. I’ve done address checks, clean up reports and home values.

review_title: Westmont College - A good place to work
job_title: in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Westmont offers a Christian environment and a  supportive, close-knit community.  Westmont has a beautiful campus in a wooded area near the Pacific Ocean.
cons: Westmont's salaries are lower than at other colleges/universities, although the benefits offered are decent.  Westmont offers no gradaute programs, so there is no way for employees to further their education beyond a bachelor's degree.

job_title: Applications Programmer in Montecito, CA
pros: Incredibly beautiful campus. Good quality student dining areas.
cons: Datatel system is old technology re-packaged as new and innovative. Under the hood, it's all command driven even to design screens. Not GUI, no mouse. Database is not relational. The users won't use Datatel because it's too complicated, Therefore, all it's data is pushed through SQL-Server and then deployed on desktops via MS-Access screens.

job_title: Research Assistant in Berkeley, CA
pros: Great way to earn a little on the side while in school full-time. Professors are super flexible and understanding when you have tests or medical emergencies.
cons: The administration is terrible and is ruining the ranking of the college. Also, they probably won't employ you for a teaching position unless you're an alumnus.

job_title: Intern in Orange, CA
pros: The people are kind and genuinely care about the students. They all do their part happily and contribute to the betterment of the school and each of its departments.
cons: It can feel small at times, but this would only be negative if you enjoyed larger working environments. Some staff are not as efficient as others.

review_title: Office of Gift Planning/ College Advancement
job_title: Administrative Assistant in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: I was a student worker for the OGP Team at the college. The OGP Team is wonderful and I can't say better things. Very supportive and understanding if you are a student. I worked for them for 3 years and I have gained experience with office duties/ data entry.
cons: The pay could be better as it is only minimum wage but other than that no issues!

job_title: Event Services in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: I love the people I worked with
cons: There is a definite distinction between the work forces: management or not. If you are not management, then you are an outsider and there is no moving up. Additionally, unless you went to Westmont, Wheaton, George Fox, or Gordon, then chances of you getting a job here are significantly reduced..

job_title: Director in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Vision for liberal arts is strong. Wonderful colleagues who are committed to the mission and vision of the college.  Amazing campus with some of the most kind-hearted employees on the planet.  Strong culture of collaboration and team work across departments.
cons: Salary can be challenging due to the high cost of living in Santa Barbara.

job_title: Director of Development in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Working at Westmont was a great experience. Being around bright students, passionate professors all set in the beautiful foothills of Santa Barbara
cons: Pay, Westmont doesn't pay staff enough to make a living in Santa Barbara. It is so expensive to live there it just doesn't work out.

review_title: I enjoyed working as a part-time piano accompanist at Westmont College.
job_title: Piano Accompanist in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Stimulating working environment, Emphasis on community building, opportunity for artistic collaboration.
cons: Low standards of excellence, lack of inspiring personality.

review_title: Great community to be a part of
